diyar 1.0.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Getting started with episode_group
    • Getting started with record_group

Episode grouping for case definitions

episode_group.Rd

This function assigns records into unique chronological episodes

episode_group(df, sn = NULL, strata = NULL, date, case_length,
  episode_type = "fixed", episode_unit = "days", episodes_max = Inf,
  recurrence_length = NULL, rolls_max = Inf, data_source = NULL,
  custom_sort = NULL, from_last = FALSE, bi_direction = FALSE,
  group_stats = FALSE, display = TRUE)

Arguments

df

Dataframe. One or more datasets appened together.
sn

numeric unique record indentifier for the dataframe.
strata

Column names. Episodes will be unique to each strata. record_group.
date

Record date. date or datetime.
case_length

Duration from the "Case" within which other records of the same strata are considered "Duplicates".
episode_type

"fixed" or "rolling".
episode_unit

Time units not less than "seconds" and supported by duration
episodes_max

Maximum number of episodes permitted in each strata.
recurrence_length

Period of recurrence in calendar days. Recurrence here refers to records ocurring after case_length of the first record but within the recurrence_length of the last duplicate record. Only used if episode_type`is "rolling". Should also be unique to each strata. Integer value between 0 and Inf
rolls_max

Maximum number of recurrence periods permitted within each episode. Only used if episode_type is "rolling".
data_source

Unique dataset indentifier for the dataframe. Useful when dataframe contains multiple datsets.
custom_sort

If TRUE, epiosde grouping assignment will begin in preference to this sort order. Useful in specifying that episode grouping begins at a particular kind of record regardless of chronological order.
from_last

If TRUE, episode grouping will be backwards in time - starting at the most recent record to the earliest. If FALSE, it'll be forward in time - starting at the earliest record to most recent.
bi_direction

If FALSE, "Duplicate" records are those within the case_length and recurrence_length before or after the "Case" as determined by from_last. If TRUE, "Duplicate" records are those on either side of the "Case".
group_stats

If TRUE, output will include two additional columns (epid_total and epid_length).
display

If TRUE, status messages are not printed on screen.

Value

Dataframe with a unique episode identifier, type of record based on the episode length and type, and if selected, a list of datasets where each episode was identified

Details

Episode grouping begins at a reference record ("Case") and proceeds forward or backward in time depending on from_last. If custom_sort is used, episode grouping can be forced to begin at certain record before proceeding forward or backwards in time. The maximun duration of a "fixed" episode is the case_length while, the maximum duration of a "rolling" episode is the case_length in addition to all recurrence periods. A recurrence period is a recurrence_length from the last "Case" or "Duplicate" record in an episode

Integer values between 0 and Inf, and should be unique to each strata

  • starts_with(), ends_with(), contains()

  • matches()

  • num_range()

  • one_of()

  • everything()

  • group_cols()

case_length must be an integer episodes_max and rolls_max must be a positive integer or Inf If "fixed", each episode will only include records within a fixed period case_length from the inital record (case). If "rolling", will include recurrent records. See recurrence_length with the number of records in each episode group, and another (epid_length) with the length of each episode

See also

record_group

Examples


library(lubridate)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'lubridate'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     date
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:lubridate':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, union
#> The following object is masked from 'package:testthat':
#> 
#>     matches
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

data <- data.frame(date = seq.Date(dmy("01/04/2018"), dmy("31/05/2018"), by="6 days"))
data$epi_len <- 15
data <- mutate(data, rd_id = row_number())

# Begin episode grouping at the earliest record thereby making it the "Case"
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, sn=rd_id, date = date, case_length = epi_len)
      )
#> Episode or recurrence window 1 .
#> 3 of 11 record(s) grouped into episodes. 8 records not yet grouped.
#> Episode or recurrence window 2 .
#> 3 of 8 record(s) grouped into episodes. 5 records not yet grouped.
#> Episode or recurrence window 3 .
#> 3 of 5 record(s) grouped into episodes. 2 records not yet grouped.
#> Episode or recurrence window 4 .
#> 2 of 2 record(s) grouped into episodes. 0 records not yet grouped.
#> 
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      15     1  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      15     2  2    1 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      15     3  3    1 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      15     4  4    4      Case
#> 5  2018-04-25      15     5  5    4 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      15     6  6    4 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      15     7  7    7      Case
#> 8  2018-05-13      15     8  8    7 Duplicate
#> 9  2018-05-19      15     9  9    7 Duplicate
#> 10 2018-05-25      15    10 10   10      Case
#> 11 2018-05-31      15    11 11   10 Duplicate

# Begin episode grouping at the most recent record thereby making it the "Case"
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, from_last = TRUE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      15     1  1    2 Duplicate
#> 2  2018-04-07      15     2  2    2      Case
#> 3  2018-04-13      15     3  3    5 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      15     4  4    5 Duplicate
#> 5  2018-04-25      15     5  5    5      Case
#> 6  2018-05-01      15     6  6    8 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      15     7  7    8 Duplicate
#> 8  2018-05-13      15     8  8    8      Case
#> 9  2018-05-19      15     9  9   11 Duplicate
#> 10 2018-05-25      15    10 10   11 Duplicate
#> 11 2018-05-31      15    11 11   11      Case

# Create rolling episodes
data$recur <- 30
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episode_type = "rolling",
                    recurrence_length = recur, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      15     1    30  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      15     2    30  2    1 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      15     3    30  3    1 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      15     4    30  4    1 Recurrent
#> 5  2018-04-25      15     5    30  5    1 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      15     6    30  6    1 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      15     7    30  7    1 Duplicate
#> 8  2018-05-13      15     8    30  8    1 Recurrent
#> 9  2018-05-19      15     9    30  9    1 Duplicate
#> 10 2018-05-25      15    10    30 10    1 Duplicate
#> 11 2018-05-31      15    11    30 11    1 Duplicate

# Limit the amount of possible recurrence period
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episode_type = "rolling",
                    recurrence_length = recur, rolls_max = 1, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      15     1    30  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      15     2    30  2    1 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      15     3    30  3    1 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      15     4    30  4    1 Recurrent
#> 5  2018-04-25      15     5    30  5    1 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      15     6    30  6    1 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      15     7    30  7    1 Duplicate
#> 8  2018-05-13      15     8    30  8    8      Case
#> 9  2018-05-19      15     9    30  9    8 Duplicate
#> 10 2018-05-25      15    10    30 10    8 Duplicate
#> 11 2018-05-31      15    11    30 11    8 Recurrent

# Limit the number of times episode grouping occurs
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episode_type = "fixed",
                    recurrence_length = recur, episodes_max = 1, from_last = FALSE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 8 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      15     1    30  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      15     2    30  2    1 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      15     3    30  3    1 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      15     4    30  4    4      Case
#> 5  2018-04-25      15     5    30  5    5      Case
#> 6  2018-05-01      15     6    30  6    6      Case
#> 7  2018-05-07      15     7    30  7    7      Case
#> 8  2018-05-13      15     8    30  8    8      Case
#> 9  2018-05-19      15     9    30  9    9      Case
#> 10 2018-05-25      15    10    30 10   10      Case
#> 11 2018-05-31      15    11    30 11   11      Case

# User defined case assignment
data$infection <- c("BSI", rep("UTI",2), "UTI", "BSI",  "UTI", rep("BSI",2), "RTI","RTI","BSI")

  # When there is a combination with UTI, BSI and RTI records within the same case or recurrence length, preference for case assignment is UTI > BSI > RTI
data$infection <- factor(data$infection, levels = c("UTI","BSI","RTI"))

  # Different type of records can have different case or recurrence lengths
data <- mutate(data,
               epi_len = case_when(
                 infection == "BSI" ~ 14,
                 infection == "UTI" ~ 30,
                 infection == "RTI" ~ 60
                 )
               )

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len,
                    recurrence_length = recur, custom_sort = infection, group_stats = TRUE, from_last = FALSE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 3 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI  2    2      Case
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI  3    2 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI  4    2 Duplicate
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI  5    2 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI  6    2 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI  7    7      Case
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI  8    7 Duplicate
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI  9    7 Duplicate
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI 10   10      Case
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI 11   11      Case

  # Can make it such that, only when the combination includes BSI records should preference go to the BSI record
  # When it's a combination without a "BSI" record, preference for case assignment reverts back to the earliest or most recent record depending on from_last
data$infection_ord <- ifelse(data$infection =="BTI",0,1)

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len,
                    custom_sort = infection_ord, group_stats = TRUE, from_last = FALSE, bi_direction = TRUE, display = FALSE)
)
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1  1    1      Case
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             1  2    1 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             1  3    1 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             1  4    4      Case
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1  5    4 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             1  6    4 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1  7    4 Duplicate
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1  8    4 Duplicate
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1  9    9      Case
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1 10    9 Duplicate
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1 11    9 Duplicate

  #Can make it such that, duplicates on either side of the case are grouped into the same episode
data$infection_ord <- ifelse(data$infection =="RTI",0,1)

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len,
                   custom_sort = infection_ord, group_stats = TRUE, from_last = FALSE, bi_direction = TRUE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1  1    9 Duplicate
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             1  2    9 Duplicate
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             1  3    9 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             1  4    9 Duplicate
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1  5    9 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             1  6    9 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1  7    9 Duplicate
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1  8    9 Duplicate
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             0  9    9      Case
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             0 10    9 Duplicate
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1 11    9 Duplicate

data$infection_ord <- ifelse(data$infection =="UTI",0,1)

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episodes_max = 1,
                    custom_sort = infection_ord, group_stats = TRUE, from_last = FALSE, bi_direction = TRUE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 5 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord sn epid   case_nm
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1  1    2 Duplicate
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             0  2    2      Case
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             0  3    2 Duplicate
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             0  4    2 Duplicate
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1  5    2 Duplicate
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             0  6    2 Duplicate
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1  7    7      Case
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1  8    8      Case
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1  9    9      Case
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1 10   10      Case
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1 11   11      Case

# Stratified episode grouping
data$patient_id <- c(rep("PID 1",8), rep("PID 2",3))
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, strata = patient_id, case_length = epi_len,
                    recurrence_length = recur, episodes_max = 1, from_last = FALSE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 5 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord patient_id sn epid
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1      PID 1  1    1
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             0      PID 1  2    1
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             0      PID 1  3    1
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             0      PID 1  4    4
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1      PID 1  5    5
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             0      PID 1  6    6
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1      PID 1  7    7
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1      PID 1  8    8
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1      PID 2  9    9
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1      PID 2 10    9
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1      PID 2 11    9
#>      case_nm
#> 1       Case
#> 2  Duplicate
#> 3  Duplicate
#> 4       Case
#> 5       Case
#> 6       Case
#> 7       Case
#> 8       Case
#> 9       Case
#> 10 Duplicate
#> 11 Duplicate

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, strata = c(patient_id, infection), case_length = epi_len,
                    recurrence_length = recur, episodes_max = 1, from_last = FALSE, display = FALSE)
      )
#> Episode grouping complete - 5 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord patient_id sn epid
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1      PID 1  1    1
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             0      PID 1  2    2
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             0      PID 1  3    2
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             0      PID 1  4    2
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1      PID 1  5    5
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             0      PID 1  6    2
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1      PID 1  7    7
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1      PID 1  8    8
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1      PID 2  9    9
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1      PID 2 10    9
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1      PID 2 11   11
#>      case_nm
#> 1       Case
#> 2       Case
#> 3  Duplicate
#> 4  Duplicate
#> 5       Case
#> 6  Duplicate
#> 7       Case
#> 8       Case
#> 9       Case
#> 10 Duplicate
#> 11      Case

# data_source is useful when grouping episodes across multiple datasets or as diagnostic option
cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episode_type = "fixed",
                    recurrence_length = recur, episodes_max = 1, data_source = infection, from_last = FALSE, display = FALSE)
)
#> Episode grouping complete - 8 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord patient_id sn epid
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1      PID 1  1    1
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             0      PID 1  2    1
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             0      PID 1  3    1
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             0      PID 1  4    4
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1      PID 1  5    5
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             0      PID 1  6    6
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1      PID 1  7    7
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1      PID 1  8    8
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1      PID 2  9    9
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1      PID 2 10   10
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1      PID 2 11   11
#>      case_nm epid_dataset
#> 1       Case      BSI,UTI
#> 2  Duplicate      BSI,UTI
#> 3  Duplicate      BSI,UTI
#> 4       Case          UTI
#> 5       Case          BSI
#> 6       Case          UTI
#> 7       Case          BSI
#> 8       Case          BSI
#> 9       Case          RTI
#> 10      Case          RTI
#> 11      Case          BSI

cbind(data,
      episode_group(data, rd_id, date=date, case_length = epi_len, episode_type = "fixed",
                    recurrence_length = recur, episodes_max = 1, data_source = c(patient_id, infection), display = FALSE)
)
#> Episode grouping complete - 8 record(s) assinged a unique ID.
#>  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          date epi_len rd_id recur infection infection_ord patient_id sn epid
#> 1  2018-04-01      14     1    30       BSI             1      PID 1  1    1
#> 2  2018-04-07      30     2    30       UTI             0      PID 1  2    1
#> 3  2018-04-13      30     3    30       UTI             0      PID 1  3    1
#> 4  2018-04-19      30     4    30       UTI             0      PID 1  4    4
#> 5  2018-04-25      14     5    30       BSI             1      PID 1  5    5
#> 6  2018-05-01      30     6    30       UTI             0      PID 1  6    6
#> 7  2018-05-07      14     7    30       BSI             1      PID 1  7    7
#> 8  2018-05-13      14     8    30       BSI             1      PID 1  8    8
#> 9  2018-05-19      60     9    30       RTI             1      PID 2  9    9
#> 10 2018-05-25      60    10    30       RTI             1      PID 2 10   10
#> 11 2018-05-31      14    11    30       BSI             1      PID 2 11   11
#>      case_nm        epid_dataset
#> 1       Case PID 1-BSI,PID 1-UTI
#> 2  Duplicate PID 1-BSI,PID 1-UTI
#> 3  Duplicate PID 1-BSI,PID 1-UTI
#> 4       Case           PID 1-UTI
#> 5       Case           PID 1-BSI
#> 6       Case           PID 1-UTI
#> 7       Case           PID 1-BSI
#> 8       Case           PID 1-BSI
#> 9       Case           PID 2-RTI
#> 10      Case           PID 2-RTI
#> 11      Case           PID 2-BSI
